ViconiaMapping.synopsis: A disguised Viconia approaches the player and sits down beside them. They will ask questions to uncover the depths of their psyche. Before potentially inviting them to enter the Grotto.
ViconiaMapping.how_to_trigger: 1. Bring Shadowheart2. Go to the House of Grief3.Talk to Mirie to get permission to enter.4. Enter the backroom5. Sit down on bench

AD_Combat_Viconia_003.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_Viconia. AD triggered when taking a turn

GriefGuard_001.synopsis: One-node dialog for the guard at the House of Grief. A sentry posing as a greeter/usher
GriefGuard_001.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the House of Grief in LOW2. Talk to the guard

AD_AttendantGreeting.synopsis: Attendant welcomes player to the House of Grief.

AD_CollectionBox.synopsis: Acknowledging the collections box when clicking on it.
AD_CollectionBox.how_to_trigger: 1. Click on the collections box in the house of grief.

AD_SentryAttendantTalk.synopsis: The sentry guard talks with the grief attendant.
AD_SentryAttendantTalk.how_to_trigger: 1. Talk to the door sentry in house of grief2. Pass easy deception check to make him go to the attendant.3. Finish dialog.4. Wait

AD_AttendantChamber.synopsis: Attendant tells player to sit down in order to begin the mapping of the heart
AD_AttendantChamber.how_to_trigger: 1. Bring shadowheart2. Go to house of grief3. Talk to attendant4. Get permission to enter the room5. Follow

AD_Combat_Viconia_002.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_Viconia. AD triggered when taking a turn

ConfusedMerchant.synopsis: A confused merchant still lingers by the House of Grief after his unburdening (he came for grief counseling, only to have his memories stolen). Players can learn he is missing memories as a clue towards the House of Grief's true purpose.
ConfusedMerchant.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the House of Grief2. Talk to Arves

DoorSentry.synopsis: A guard at the House of Grief. He stands sentry at the door leading to the Mapping room.
DoorSentry.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the House of Grief in LOW2. Talk to the guard

AD_AttackedIllusion.synopsis: If the Inquirer of Grief is attacked, a disembodied voice will invite the party inside.
AD_AttackedIllusion.how_to_trigger: 1. Sit down on bench in house of grief2. Attack Inquirer of Grief3. Wait

AD_Combat_Viconia_001.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_Viconia. AD triggered when taking a turn

AD_ChideSentry.synopsis: Attendant chides sentry for slacking off.

AD_SentrySideStep.synopsis: The door sentry tells the player to go in.
AD_SentrySideStep.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to House of Grief2. Talk to door sentry3, Pass the intimidation check4. Finish dialog5. Wait

AD_Combat_Viconia_000.how_to_trigger: Fight S_LOW_Viconia. AD triggered when taking a turn

GriefGuard_000.synopsis: One-node dialog for the guard at the House of Grief. The guard presents herself as an usher/greeter for the House of Grief - outwardly friendly and welcoming, while in truth acting as sentry.
GriefGuard_000.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the House of Grief in LOW2. Talk to the guard

AD_FetchDocument.synopsis: Grief attendant requests grief guard to fetch some papers.

GriefAttendant.synopsis: Serves as the front desk for the House of Grief. Encourages the player to partake of their services in exchange for a fee. Secretly a Sharran agent seeking to lure in the unwitting.
GriefAttendant.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to the House of Grief2.Talk to Mirie

AD_MerchantGoodbye.synopsis: Grief guard bids the confused merchant farewell.

AD_MerchantGossip.synopsis: Grief guard talks with another grief guard about the merchant.

PAD_CollectionBox.synopsis: Acknowledging the collections box when clicking on it.
PAD_CollectionBox.how_to_trigger: 1. Click on the collections box in the house of grief.

AD_ViconiaIllusionSeated.synopsis: Viconia calls out to the player to sit if they haven't already.
AD_ViconiaIllusionSeated.how_to_trigger: 1. Enter the bak chamber of the house of grief2. Wait

AD_SpotSquirrel.synopsis: The confused merchant at the house of grief thinks he spots something up in the tree.

ViconiaMapping_76.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: A hooded figure appears in frame and sits next to the player on the stone bench facing the opposite direction. The player starts to turn their head to look at the figure, who rebukes them. The player looks forward again.NodeContext: Sharp

ViconiaMapping_85.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_85.text: This is your time, not mine. Look inward. See what will be discovered.

ViconiaMapping_5.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_5.text: Do not be concerned with who I am. Instead consider what I can do for you.

ViconiaMapping_18.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_18.text: You are here because something grieves you. Perhaps you know what that is. Perhaps you merely think you know.

ViconiaMapping_112.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_112.text: The Mapping will reveal your heartform. Then the healing can begin.

ViconiaMapping_60.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_60.text: Answer the questions I put to you. And answer honestly - the lips may try to deceive, but the heart will offer the truth, in the end. Let us begin.

ViconiaMapping_41.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_41.text: What last caused you to shed a tear?

ViconiaMapping_14.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_14.text: So be it. The second question. What is your unspoken desire?

ViconiaMapping_103.speaker: Narrator
ViconiaMapping_103.text: *An unfamiliar presence caresses the deepest layers of your mind. You realise she's trying to detect your thoughts.*

ViconiaMapping_48.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_48.text: Drop the act. You're not here to help - you're trying to dig around in my thoughts.

ViconiaMapping_63.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_63.text: And this is the most effective way of helping. Besides, you are not above slipping into another's mind - I saw for myself.

ViconiaMapping_30.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_30.text: But let us spare the pretence. It seems you and I have more to speak of than your heart's struggles.

ViconiaMapping_47.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_47.text: For the record, you have a violent heart.

ViconiaMapping_70.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_70.text: For the record, you have a craven heart.

ViconiaMapping_107.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_107.text: For the record, you have a jealous heart.

ViconiaMapping_9.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_9.text: For the record, you have a melancholy heart.

ViconiaMapping_21.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_21.text: For the record, you have a prying heart.

ViconiaMapping_3.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_3.text: For the record, you have a false heart.

ViconiaMapping_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hooded figure stands and faces the player, reaching for her hood.

ViconiaMapping_86.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_86.text: The second question. What is your unspoken desire?

ViconiaMapping_24.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_24.text: To run away from it all.

ViconiaMapping_106.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_106.text: Your heartform begins to take shape. The third question. What is your greatest fear?

ViconiaMapping_69.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_69.text: The heartform grows clearer again. Such a burden you carry. But we can help.

ViconiaMapping_82.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_82.text: The fourth question. How would you spite one who wronged you?

ViconiaMapping_97.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_97.text: I would not. I would forgive them.

ViconiaMapping_71.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_71.text: Truly? A soft heart is not always a virtue. You have sought our help just in time.

ViconiaMapping_75.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_75.text: I would forgive them, but slowly poison them.

ViconiaMapping_81.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_81.text: Ah... lil alurl velve zhah lil velkyn uss...
ViconiaMapping_81.context: NodeContext: Approving. A drow saying, meaning 'the best knife is the unseen one' Pronounced 'Lill allurl veh-elv zah lill vel-kin us'

ViconiaMapping_6.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_6.text: The final question. How would you feel, if all your burdens were lifted?

ViconiaMapping_40.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_40.text: Truly? Perhaps you crave a dull life then.

ViconiaMapping_12.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_12.text: Curious. Perhaps you fear life without conflict. Perhaps you will invent some, for your own gratification.

ViconiaMapping_19.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_19.text: Wise. Healthy suspicion can prove to be the finest armour.

ViconiaMapping_36.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_36.text: I would manifest new burdens within a tenday.

ViconiaMapping_11.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_11.text: Perhaps you fear happiness. It is not as uncommon as you may think.

ViconiaMapping_105.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_105.text: It is done. Your heartform has revealed itself to me.

ViconiaMapping_33.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_33.text: You possess a violent heart. Rage grips you. Blood inflames you. The House of Grief knows such burdens - and can lift such burdens.

ViconiaMapping_62.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_62.text: All right. I want you to help me.

ViconiaMapping_56.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_56.text: This is your own judgement of yourself. Embrace the truth your heart shares, however painful.

ViconiaMapping_90.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_90.text: Our help comes at a price. One that cannot be discussed here. We will talk further, but first, an introduction.
ViconiaMapping_90.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hooded figure stands and faces the player, reaching for her hood.

ViconiaMapping_111.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_111.text: I am Viconia DeVir. The House of Grief is mine. But what lies beneath... that belongs to my mistress, and that is where you must go.
ViconiaMapping_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looked up at drow woman. Ageless, elegant, silver-haired. Viconia DeVir.

ViconiaMapping_109.speaker: Jaheira
ViconiaMapping_109.text: Viconia DeVir. Alas, I know you a little too well to follow you into a dark hole in the ground.
ViconiaMapping_109.context: NodeContext: Distaste at seeing an old acquaintance she was forced to travel with in the past.

ViconiaMapping_65.speaker: Minsc
ViconiaMapping_65.text: You! Boo would have caught your foul scent, had you not confounded his nose with evil Sharran incense.
ViconiaMapping_65.context: NodeContext: Low, indignant - not happy to see Viconia again.

ViconiaMapping_7.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_7.text: Always a pleasure to see old acquaintances. But you would be wise to not interfere in what is to come.
ViconiaMapping_7.context: NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

ViconiaMapping_104.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_104.text: She will find the path ahead where she always has.

ViconiaMapping_67.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_67.text: We will talk more down below.

ViconiaMapping_66.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_66.text: You possess a craven heart. You flee when you should fight, seek to soften every hard choice. You are untempered. But we can help.

ViconiaMapping_46.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_46.text: You possess a jealous heart. Your wants are endless. All others are undeserving of any boon next to you. Envy is a fire that will consume you, but we can help douse it.

ViconiaMapping_53.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_53.text: You possess a melancholy heart. A smile is a stranger upon your lips. You do not know what you are missing, but you miss it nonetheless. We can spare you this pain.

ViconiaMapping_2.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_2.text: You possess a prying heart. You crave insights and secrets that are not your own. You live through others, and neglect the self. We can help you rediscover you.

ViconiaMapping_54.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_54.text: You possess a false heart - deceiving as easily others breathe. You hide the truth even from yourself. But your true self is nothing to fear. We can show you this.

ViconiaMapping_88.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_88.text: I would be lesser - my burdens moulded me.

ViconiaMapping_92.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_92.text: You know the value of suffering - good. Life is full of it, whether you welcome it or not.

ViconiaMapping_108.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_108.text: I would be grateful to the gods.

ViconiaMapping_51.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_51.text: Not all gods are worthy of gratitude.

ViconiaMapping_77.speaker: Narrator
ViconiaMapping_77.text: *The drow dialect. Something about a hidden knife. A curious sentiment for such a place.*

ViconiaMapping_10.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_10.text: I would challenge them publicly, and humiliate them before all.

ViconiaMapping_114.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_114.text: Indeed? Reputations can be slower to heal than flesh...

ViconiaMapping_49.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_49.text: I spare them - but hunt down their beloved.

ViconiaMapping_89.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_89.text: I would fabricate a grave threat, and let them live in fear of it.

ViconiaMapping_31.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_31.text: To indulge every hunger, every lust.

ViconiaMapping_83.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_83.text: To bathe in wealth and power.

ViconiaMapping_17.speaker: Player
ViconiaMapping_17.text: Do I detect traces of the Underdark in your voice?

ViconiaMapping_58.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_58.text: And what if you did? It is not the timbre of my voice that matters; it is the wisdom it can impart to you.

ViconiaMapping_72.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_72.text: Immaterial. Please, as I said. We are here to help you.

ViconiaMapping_39.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
ViconiaMapping_39.text: Hush. You have already taken the first difficult step. Now you merely have to sit here a while and talk to me.

AD_Combat_Viconia_003_0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_Combat_Viconia_003_0.context: NodeContext: 'l-ill allure' - battle cry while in combat with the player

GriefGuard_001_0.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_0.text: Take your time, look around. Only you can decide when it is time for healing.

GriefGuard_001_1.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_1.text: Welcome, friend. Your burdens are soon to be made as light as a feather. Trust me.

GriefGuard_001_2.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_2.text: Lady Shar blesses us with a true leader. Let us usher in a new era, under your command.

GriefGuard_001_3.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_3.text: Do not waste my time. Your fate will be decided beyond those doors over there.

GriefGuard_001_4.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_4.text: I serve you, my lady. Forgive any past slights, please. Honest zeal, nothing more.

GriefGuard_001_5.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_5.text: Peace, please. Enough damage has been done already.

GriefGuard_001_6.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_6.text: I have no quarrel with you. Whatever you did down there... leave me out of it.

GriefGuard_001_7.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
GriefGuard_001_7.text: The apostate. Even more wretched-looking than the rumours claimed.

AD_AttendantGreeting_0.speaker: Mirie
AD_AttendantGreeting_0.text: The House of Grief welcomes you - and stands ready to ease your troubles.

AD_CollectionBox_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_CollectionBox_0.text: *Within, metal pieces shift about. Gold, perhaps.*

AD_SentryAttendantTalk_1.speaker: Morann
AD_SentryAttendantTalk_1.text: Is it true then? You gave that one permission to enter?

AD_SentryAttendantTalk_0.speaker: Mirie
AD_SentryAttendantTalk_0.text: What are you talking about? Of course not - you know the rules.

AD_AttendantChamber_0.speaker: Mirie
AD_AttendantChamber_0.text: Have a seat. The mapping with begin shortly.

AD_Combat_Viconia_002_0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_Combat_Viconia_002_0.text: I will make your death an offering to Lady Shar.
AD_Combat_Viconia_002_0.context: NodeContext: Battle cry/taunt directed at the player during combat

ConfusedMerchant_19.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_19.text: I think I should be quite happy, living in a tree. Greenery and birdsong all around.

ConfusedMerchant_26.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_26.text: Quite the life, leaping from branch to branch without a care in the world...

ConfusedMerchant_57.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_57.text: Wonderful little beast... nimble as anything!
ConfusedMerchant_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: The man is gazing upwards at the bough of a tree, a serene, dazed expression on his face.

ConfusedMerchant_43.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_43.text: There was a squirrel in the tree. Marvellous creature. Inquisitive and nut-crazed!

ConfusedMerchant_81.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_81.text: You're fawning over some tree-vermin? Perhaps you've taken too much sun, or wine.

ConfusedMerchant_14.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_14.text: Hmm? Oh yes, perhaps. It's been... well, I'm not quite sure how long it's been.

ConfusedMerchant_27.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_27.text: ...You wouldn't happen to know where I live, would you?

ConfusedMerchant_87.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_87.text: I see. It must have just... slipped my mind. These things happen.

ConfusedMerchant_51.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_51.text: I doubt you're from around here. Who even are you?

ConfusedMerchant_36.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_36.text: I am... I am... very pleased to meet your acquaintance. And you are?

ConfusedMerchant_44.speaker: Narrator
ConfusedMerchant_44.text: *This is more than a lapse, you sense. Something's been done to the man's memories.*

ConfusedMerchant_31.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_31.text: Do you know someone called Moyra?

ConfusedMerchant_69.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_69.text: Moyra... yes - no. I don't know. I think I remember a face. Smiling, young, then older, then ill, then...

ConfusedMerchant_74.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_74.text: No, I don't think so. You must be mistaken, friend. I don't know anyone by that name.

ConfusedMerchant_1.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_1.text: Well, I remember I was sad... but in truth, I'm not quite sure what caused it. I'm not even sure I know what sad is anymore.

ConfusedMerchant_64.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_64.text: And I came from that building over there. They were very nice to me. Seemed very helpful. Though... for the life of me, I can't recall what I was doing there in the first place.

ConfusedMerchant_40.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_40.text: Is there anyone you can go to? Anyone who could help?

ConfusedMerchant_24.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_24.text: There must be, you would think...

ConfusedMerchant_30.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_30.text: You know, I can swear there is someone, but their name escapes me. Hells, even their face escapes me. A figment of my imagination, perhaps.

ConfusedMerchant_49.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_49.text: It will come back to me. Or not. I'm content enough here in either case.

ConfusedMerchant_77.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_77.text: See what you can learn from his thoughts.

ConfusedMerchant_72.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_72.text: What do you think you're doing?! Poking around where you don't belong - I'll show you!

ConfusedMerchant_50.speaker: Narrator
ConfusedMerchant_50.text: *The man's mind is a stream of fragmented thoughts - each brushed away by another before it can take purchase...*

ConfusedMerchant_48.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_48.text: Marvellous day... not a care in the world. Moyra would have loved this garden. Wait, who's she...?

ConfusedMerchant_90.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_90.text: Moyra sent me. She said you had money I was to bring to her - household expenses.

ConfusedMerchant_32.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_32.text: Moyra... do I know her? Yes... yes I think I do. How much does she need?

ConfusedMerchant_73.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_73.text: Who's Moyra? What household? I think you've got the wrong person, friend.

ConfusedMerchant_82.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_82.text: I am from the Baldurian Bank. I've come to collect interest on your debt.

ConfusedMerchant_61.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_61.text: I'm a debt collector. You owe me a lot of money, you know.

ConfusedMerchant_54.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_54.text: I... I do not recall this, in all honesty.

ConfusedMerchant_79.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_79.text: How much are we talking about...?

ConfusedMerchant_3.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_3.text: Ugh, take it. Now begone, you vulture.

ConfusedMerchant_28.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_28.text: Ugh, take it. Now away with you, carrion bird.

ConfusedMerchant_71.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_71.text: I'm afraid my purse can't quite match such a sum right now. You'll simply have to collect your gold another time.

ConfusedMerchant_18.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_18.text: I don't have that much on me.

ConfusedMerchant_84.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_84.text: I have this - I didn't want to let go of it.

ConfusedMerchant_6.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_6.text: Probably nothing important. Better to be unburdened - I think someone told me that once.

ConfusedMerchant_8.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_8.text: What? Preposterous! I don't even know you.

ConfusedMerchant_68.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_68.text: You seem confused - taken a bump to the head lately, perhaps?

ConfusedMerchant_88.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_88.text: Oh no, nothing like that - I'm fit as a fiddle. It's just that certain things are... eluding me.

ConfusedMerchant_47.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_47.text: Do I look like I'm from around here?

ConfusedMerchant_11.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_11.text: Are you feeling well? You seem... distracted.

ConfusedMerchant_83.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_83.text: Oh, just tired, I suppose. It's been quite a long day. Or at least I think it has.

ConfusedMerchant_59.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_59.text: You'd get on well with someone I know called Halsin.

ConfusedMerchant_53.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_53.text: Halsin... is he of the Fayburgs? The candelabra makers?

ConfusedMerchant_35.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_35.text: He's a druid, so I doubt it.

ConfusedMerchant_66.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_66.text: Hmm, perhaps it was Hagrin. Wonderful craftspeople, but truly terrible dealmakers...

ConfusedMerchant_7.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_7.text: Give it time. I had to wait for - oh, I don't even know how long - to catch a glimpse...

ConfusedMerchant_85.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_85.text: While I have made friends with many a squirrel, I do not see one here.

ConfusedMerchant_39.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_39.text: You either have sharper eyes than mine, or there is no squirrel here.

ConfusedMerchant_25.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_25.text: A moment... you don't happen to know where I live, do you?

ConfusedMerchant_58.speaker: Arves
ConfusedMerchant_58.text: Hmm? Oh, apologies. I was a captive audience.

ConfusedMerchant_62.speaker: Narrator
ConfusedMerchant_62.text: *A man of means, judging by his attire. He looks like a merchant or a junior council member. But right now he's without care, entranced by a tree.*

ConfusedMerchant_22.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_22.text: Examine the man's attire, expression - anything of note.

ConfusedMerchant_4.speaker: Player
ConfusedMerchant_4.text: Look the target over, examining him.

DoorSentry_3.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_3.text: The rules apply, same as before. No entry without express permission.

DoorSentry_5.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_5.text: Nobody's allowed through here without permission... even you.

DoorSentry_7.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_7.text: Hands to yourself. What's through there isn't for you - not without permission.

DoorSentry_15.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_15.text: You're eager - good. But there is a right order to things - before you can enter, you must agree to the House of Grief's terms - and price.

DoorSentry_33.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_33.text: Speak to the attendant by the front. She will put everything in order for you. Then you will be free to enter.

DoorSentry_45.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_45.text: That is where the Mapping of the Heart takes place - where all who seek to be unburdened open themselves up and lay their wounds and sorrows bare.

DoorSentry_11.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_11.text: But it is not for you. Not yet.

DoorSentry_44.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_44.text: You seem to recall my face. Likely you'll know I'm expected.

DoorSentry_20.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_20.text: Then it should be remarkably easy for you to obtain the correct permissions. See to that, and I will be out of your way.

DoorSentry_9.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_9.text: I've already gotten permission - go speak to the attendant if you don't believe me.

DoorSentry_2.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_2.text: Hmm. Perhaps I should do just that.

DoorSentry_40.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_40.text: And leave my posted unmanned in the meanwhile? No. You can enter on our terms, or not at all.

DoorSentry_25.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_25.text: You can drop the act, brother. We both know what this place truly is. Let me pass.

DoorSentry_31.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_31.text: Enough. We both know what this place truly is, and who is worshipped here. Let me pass.

DoorSentry_18.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_18.text: Let's not get tangled up in bureaucracy, shall we? Easier to just let me pass.

DoorSentry_46.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_46.text: Fine - just remember that what happens through those doors and beyond is secret. On you go.

DoorSentry_41.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_41.text: Fine. I'll bend the rules this once - in the interest of charity. In you go.

DoorSentry_29.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_29.text: It doesn't matter what you think you know about this place friend. All that matters is having permission - which you're lacking.

DoorSentry_23.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_23.text: Easier for who? You? Afraid not, friend. You enter by the book, or not at all.

DoorSentry_42.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_42.text: We both know who is truly worshipped here. I am her chosen warrior. Stand aside, or feel her wrath.

DoorSentry_38.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_38.text: I know what this place is. Stand aside, or you soon won't be standing at all.

DoorSentry_8.speaker: Player
DoorSentry_8.text: If you insist on standing on ceremony, soon you won't be standing at all. Got it?

DoorSentry_27.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_27.text: I... I didn't realise. Apologies, please enter.

DoorSentry_48.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_48.text: All right, enter. Just don't cause trouble, and keep our secrets secret.

DoorSentry_12.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_12.text: Got it. In you go - just don't cause any trouble.

DoorSentry_14.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_14.text: Chosen you may be, but I have my duty. The door stays shut until you have permission.

DoorSentry_24.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_24.text: Threats, is it? Whatever you think you know about this place is irrelevant. The door stays shut until you have permission.

DoorSentry_26.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_26.text: Threats, is it? You truly do need our help, friend - but on our terms. There's nothing more to be said until you have permission.

DoorSentry_17.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_17.text: You can trust my loyalty, m'lady. The Nightsinger has chosen you.

DoorSentry_19.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_19.text: I wouldn't be standing here if you were allowed to pass.

DoorSentry_21.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_21.text: M'lady. An honour to serve you.

DoorSentry_22.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_22.text: The writing's on the wall... along with a fair bit of blood, I suspect. You'll get no trouble from me.

DoorSentry_30.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_30.text: I've no quarrel with you. None at all.

DoorSentry_35.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_35.text: Like I said. You need permission to go any farther.

DoorSentry_36.speaker: Morann
DoorSentry_36.text: Nobody's allowed through here without permission... least of all you.

AD_AttackedIllusion_0.speaker: Familiar Voice
AD_AttackedIllusion_0.text: Enough - stay your hand and proceed downwards. There is more to discuss.
AD_AttackedIllusion_0.context: NodeContext: Some irritation (the player attacked 'her' (actually an illusion of her).

AD_Combat_Viconia_001_0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_Combat_Viconia_001_0.context: NodeContext: Battle cry/taunt directed at player during combat

AD_ChideSentry_1.speaker: Mirie
AD_ChideSentry_1.text: You're supposed to guard the door. No more slacking or I'll report you to her.
AD_ChideSentry_1.context: NodeContext: Chastisting. 'her' with a hint of threat -  refers to their feared behind-the-scenes leader

AD_ChideSentry_0.speaker: Morann
AD_ChideSentry_0.text: No need for that. Just needed to stretch my legs - won't happen again.
AD_ChideSentry_0.context: NodeContext: nervous at the thought of being reported to his feared behind-the-scenes boss.

AD_SentrySideStep_1.speaker: Morann
AD_SentrySideStep_1.text: Take a seat once you're inside.

AD_Combat_Viconia_000_0.speaker: Viconia DeVir
AD_Combat_Viconia_000_0.context: NodeContext: Battle cry/taunt directed at player

GriefGuard_000_0.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_0.text: Please, do not delay. Contentment is within your grasp - just step inside, with an open mind.

GriefGuard_000_1.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_1.text: Welcome, the House of Grief lies just within. We are here to help.

GriefGuard_000_2.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_2.text: I always knew you were destined for greatness, my lady. It is my great shame that I never voiced it sooner.
GriefGuard_000_2.context: NodeContext: Grovelling, Speaking to her one-time peer turned boss.

GriefGuard_000_3.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_3.text: Waste no more time out here. You have much to explain within.

GriefGuard_000_4.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_4.text: My Lady... it is true then. You are now the Nightsinger's chosen. Long may you rule.
GriefGuard_000_4.context: NodeContext: Grovelling, Speaking to her one-time peer turned boss.

GriefGuard_000_5.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_5.text: So it's true... you have prevailed. I want no trouble - only a fool would seek to share in the Mother Superior's fate.
GriefGuard_000_5.context: NodeContext: Peacemaking. Henchwoman left unscathed after her boss has been defeated

GriefGuard_000_6.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_6.text: Perhaps it would be wise to leave matters there. No need for more bloodshed.
GriefGuard_000_6.context: NodeContext: Peacemaking. Henchwoman left unscathed after her boss has been defeated

GriefGuard_000_7.speaker: Griefguard Afara
GriefGuard_000_7.text: You. Enter at once. She has been awaiting you.

AD_FetchDocument_0.speaker: Mirie
AD_FetchDocument_0.text: I need the list of properties donated to us by our guests - the Counting House requires valuations.
AD_FetchDocument_0.context: NodeContext: Clerical work/giving orders (hint that they're swindling people out of their possessions)

GriefAttendant_2.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_2.text: Please enter. The Mapping of the Heart will begin once you are seated.

GriefAttendant_5.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_5.text: We have long awaited your return, sister. Please, do not delay. The Mother Superior awaits.

GriefAttendant_8.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_8.text: Greetings once again. Perhaps you have had a change of heart? The Unburdening can provide succour to all.

GriefAttendant_11.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_11.text: Welcome again, my lady. Your victory over the apostate Viconia gladdens me - now we may have a true leader.

GriefAttendant_15.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_15.text: You dare return, after all you did...? You should go and face the Mother Superior's judgement with dignity, if you're capable of such.

GriefAttendant_29.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_29.text: I know what happened down there - just leave me be. I don't want any trouble, not from you.

GriefAttendant_34.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_34.text: There is no need for violence. I understand that things have changed around here. I am no threat, I assure you.

GriefAttendant_39.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_39.text: Please, enter. The Mapping of the Heart requires utmost privacy. It will begin as soon as you are seated.

GriefAttendant_41.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_41.text: You... you are a sight to behold, sister. I feel the Dark Lady's blessings upon you. Please, the Mother Superior awaits.

GriefAttendant_43.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_43.text: Welcome to the House of Grief. Are you here to be Unburdened?

GriefAttendant_27.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_27.text: Whatever ails the heart, whatever weighs upon the soul - we can help.

GriefAttendant_38.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_38.text: House of Grief? Quite a foreboding name...

GriefAttendant_13.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_13.text: It can deceive, I must admit. Originally we sought to help those who found themselves consumed by the loss of a loved one, but there are so many others who need our help.

GriefAttendant_1.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_1.text: We unburden people of the suffering in their hearts: melancholy, anger, self-doubt, troubling memories, and of course grief...

GriefAttendant_59.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_59.text: ...I think you could benefit from our help. In fact, I think you desperately need our help.

GriefAttendant_47.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_47.text: I sense turmoil in you, even if you cannot bring yourself to admit it.

GriefAttendant_42.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_42.text: We release people of the suffering in their hearts: melancholy, anger, self-doubt, troubling memories, and of course grief.

GriefAttendant_7.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_7.text: I desperately need help? What makes you say that?

GriefAttendant_52.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_52.text: A great deal of people in need have entered that door. In my time, I've come to recognise their suffering.

GriefAttendant_56.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_56.text: Admitting you have a problem is the first step - the hardest step. After that, we will be by your side.

GriefAttendant_3.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_3.text: You seem to think you know a lot about me.

GriefAttendant_37.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_37.text: The insight of an unburdened spirit. I too was once weighed down, but now I am free.

GriefAttendant_14.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_14.text: Before I came here, I was given to drunkeness, wanton violence, licentiousness of every sort... but now I am saved. As you can be.

GriefAttendant_45.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_45.text: Of course, my lady. Here is the key - the collections box is right behind me.

GriefAttendant_50.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_50.text: I apologise my lady, the key to the collections box has gone missing.

GriefAttendant_4.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_4.text: Mother Superior has tasked me with bringing the proceeds of the collection box to her.

GriefAttendant_49.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_49.text: Of course - here is the key. The box is behind my station, as always.

GriefAttendant_25.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_25.text: It... it seems the key has gone missing. My apologies to Mother Superior. I must have misplaced it.

GriefAttendant_35.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_35.text: That duty falls to me alone. I must assume you simply misheard her orders.

GriefAttendant_6.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_6.text: I cannot force you. But perhaps you can look inwards, and be true to yourself.

GriefAttendant_22.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_22.text: You may not like what you see, when you put yourself under scrutiny. But we can show you how to love yourself.

GriefAttendant_31.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_31.text: All right - I want to be unburdened.

GriefAttendant_44.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_44.text: There is the matter of the fee - a trifling sum compared to the peace we can grant you, rest assured. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

GriefAttendant_16.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_16.text: I can't afford to be unburdened of anything just now - especially gold.

GriefAttendant_36.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_36.text: A pity. Perhaps you can find a way to correct that - better to have a light purse than a heavy heart.

GriefAttendant_48.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_48.text: Wonderful, let the healing begin. First comes the Mapping of the Heart. You will be asked questions - it is important that you answer as truthfully as possible, so that we may know precisely what burdens you the most.

GriefAttendant_0.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_0.text: The Mapping will take place in the next chamber. Please, follow me.

GriefAttendant_30.speaker: Player
GriefAttendant_30.text: Usually a god would've been mentioned by now - is this a scam?

GriefAttendant_19.speaker: Narrator
GriefAttendant_19.text: *You sense a truth behind her words. She genuinely wants to help.*

GriefAttendant_20.speaker: Narrator
GriefAttendant_20.text: *However, it seems truth is not the only thing behind her words. Something is being hidden.*

GriefAttendant_32.speaker: Narrator
GriefAttendant_32.text: *Her expression is a pure lack of intent - she is impossible to read.*

GriefAttendant_58.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_58.text: Welcome, my lady. Your presence honours me.

GriefAttendant_60.speaker: Mirie
GriefAttendant_60.text: Incredible, that you even had the nerve to show up here. I have little else to say to the likes of you.

AD_DocumentFetched_0.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
AD_DocumentFetched_0.text: The list of properties - quite a slice of the Upper City is now ours.

AD_MerchantGoodbye_0.speaker: Griefguard Afara
AD_MerchantGoodbye_0.text: Farewell, friend. Your life starts anew from this moment.
AD_MerchantGoodbye_0.context: NodeContext: Friendly/pious. Bidding farewell to a 'client' who's memories they just stole under the guise of counselling.

AD_GuardGreeting_0.speaker: Griefguard Afara
AD_GuardGreeting_0.text: Greetings? Do you seek help? You are in the right place.
AD_GuardGreeting_0.context: NodeContext: Warm, a little pious. 'Greeter' for an operation that steals people's memories under the guise of grief counselling

AD_MerchantGossip_0.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
AD_MerchantGossip_0.text: Why does he linger, after the Unburdening?
AD_MerchantGossip_0.context: NodeContext: Curious/slightly concerned. A customer they 'helped' (stole the memories of) is lingering nearby,

AD_MerchantGossip_1.speaker: Griefguard Afara
AD_MerchantGossip_1.text: His heart has been freed - now everything he sees is joyful and like new.
AD_MerchantGossip_1.context: NodeContext: Unconcerned.  A customer they 'helped' (stole the memories of) is lingering nearby,

AD_MerchantGossip_2.speaker: Griefguard Wilbur
AD_MerchantGossip_2.text: He had best not linger, or he'll attract attention - and questions.
AD_MerchantGossip_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Slightly foreboding. A customer they 'helped' (stole the memories of) is lingering nearby,

PAD_CollectionBox_0.speaker: Player
PAD_CollectionBox_0.text: Sounds like there's gold inside. Their proceeds?

AD_ViconiaIllusionSeated_0.speaker: Inquirer of Grief
AD_ViconiaIllusionSeated_0.text: Sit. Only then may we begin.

AD_SpotSquirrel_0.speaker: Arves
AD_SpotSquirrel_0.text: Oh I see you, don't think that I don't!
AD_SpotSquirrel_0.context: NodeContext: Carefree and enthralled by a squirrel in a tree. (he's recently undergone a procedure that's wiped large portions of his memory, leaving him blissed-out and easily distracted)

AD_SpotSquirrel_1.speaker: Arves
AD_SpotSquirrel_1.text: Look at you go! Quite the acrobat, aren't you?
AD_SpotSquirrel_1.context: NodeContext: Carefree and enthralled by a squirrel in a tree. (he's recently undergone a procedure that's wiped large portions of his memory, leaving him blissed-out and easily distracted)

AD_SpotSquirrel_2.speaker: Arves
AD_SpotSquirrel_2.text: You can come closer if you like. I won't harm you.
AD_SpotSquirrel_2.context: NodeContext: Carefree and enthralled by a squirrel in a tree. (he's recently undergone a procedure that's wiped large portions of his memory, leaving him blissed-out and easily distracted)

AD_SpotSquirrel_3.speaker: Arves
AD_SpotSquirrel_3.text: Oh, it must be a grand life, bounding through the trees.
AD_SpotSquirrel_3.context: NodeContext: Carefree and enthralled by a squirrel in a tree. (he's recently undergone a procedure that's wiped large portions of his memory, leaving him blissed-out and easily distracted)
